Summarizing cTWAS results

Kaixuan Luo, Sheng Qian

2024-05-30

Source: vignettes/summarizing_ctwas_results.Rmd
summarizing_ctwas_results.Rmd

Summarizing and visualizing cTWAS results

Load the ctwas package. We also need packages tidyverse, locuszoomr for summarizing and visualizing cTWAS result

library(ctwas)
library(tidyverse)
library(locuszoomr)

We also need gene annotations from the Ensembl database. We use EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86 for the example data, please choose the Ensembl database for your specific data.

library(EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86)

Load the cTWAS results from the ctwas_sumstats() function

# directory with computed correlation matrices
cor_dir <- system.file("extdata/sample_data", "cor_matrix", package = "ctwas")

# GWAS sample size
gwas_n <- 343621

# Load region_info, LD_info and snp_info
region_info <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.region_info.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

LD_info <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.LD_info.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

snp_info <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.snp_info.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

# Load z_snp
z_snp <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.preprocessed.z_snp.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

# Load weights
weights <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.preprocessed.weights.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

# Load the cTWAS results
param <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.param.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

finemap_res <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.finemap_res.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

screened_region_data <- readRDS(system.file("extdata/sample_data", "LDL_example.screened_region_data.RDS", package = "ctwas"))

Assessing parameters and computing PVE

We could use the summarize_param() function to assess the convergence of the estimated parameters and to compute the proportion of variance explained (PVE) by variants and genes.

ctwas_parameters <- summarize_param(param, gwas_n)
# Estimated prior inclusion probability
ctwas_parameters$group_prior
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##       0.0112258728       0.0032677115       0.0002253614
# Estimated prior effect size:
ctwas_parameters$group_prior_var
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##         159.366028         159.366028           4.889058
# Estimated enrichment of molecular traits over variants:
ctwas_parameters$enrichment
##   expression|liver expression|adipose 
##           49.81275           14.49987
# PVE explained by molecular traits and variants:
ctwas_parameters$group_pve
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##       0.0021346173       0.0007335085       0.0005839915
# Total heritability (sum of PVE)
ctwas_parameters$total_pve
## [1] 0.003452117
# Attributable heritability
ctwas_parameters$attributable_pve
##   expression|liver expression|adipose                SNP 
##          0.6183502          0.2124807          0.1691691

Plot convergence

ctwas_parameters$convergence_plot

 

Summarizing cTWAS results

To interpret and visualize the results, we need to add gene names to the finemapping result, and use mid-points to represent gene positions.

# load gene info database
ens_db <- EnsDb.Hsapiens.v86

# add gene names and use gene mid-points to represent gene positions
finemap_res <- anno_finemap_res(finemap_res, snp_info, ens_db, use_gene_pos = "mid")

Interpreting cTWAS results

We list all molecular traits with PIP > 0.8, which is the threshold we used in the paper.

# select PIP > 0.8
sig_finemap_res <- finemap_res[finemap_res$type!="SNP" & finemap_res$susie_pip > 0.8,]
head(sig_finemap_res[order(-sig_finemap_res$susie_pip),])
##       chrom      pos                                                 id
## 13052    16 72070235                 ENSG00000261701.6|expression_Liver
## 13065    16 72057824  ENSG00000257017.8|expression_Adipose_Subcutaneous
## 7750     16 56972848 ENSG00000087237.10|expression_Adipose_Subcutaneous
##             type context              group          z            region_id
## 13052 expression   liver   expression|liver -18.403150 16:71020125-72901251
## 13065 expression adipose expression|adipose  -4.810203 16:71020125-72901251
## 7750  expression adipose expression|adipose  13.749840 16:55869862-57630418
##       susie_pip      mu2 cs_index         gene_id gene_name
## 13052 1.0000000 474.3442        1 ENSG00000261701       HPR
## 13065 1.0000000 420.6018        3 ENSG00000257017        HP
## 7750  0.9999615 149.3997        1 ENSG00000087237      CETP

When we have multiple contexts (tissues, conditions), it is useful to evaluate the combined PIP for each molecular trait over different contexts:

# combine PIPs across contexts (tissues)
combined_gene_pips <- sum_pip_across_contexts(finemap_res)

# select combined PIP > 0.8
sig_gene_pips_df <- combined_gene_pips[combined_gene_pips$combined_pip > 0.8, ]

# list genes with combined PIP > 0.8 or top 20 genes with highest combined PIPs
head(combined_gene_pips, max(nrow(sig_gene_pips_df), 20))
##             gene_id gene_name combined_pip    liver_pip  adipose_pip
## 12  ENSG00000087237      CETP   1.02577519 2.581369e-02 9.999615e-01
## 151 ENSG00000261701       HPR   1.00000126 1.000000e+00 1.262840e-06
## 150 ENSG00000257017        HP   0.99999999           NA 1.000000e+00
## 77  ENSG00000153786    ZDHHC7   0.36848818 6.262351e-03 3.622258e-01
## 78  ENSG00000156853    ZNF689   0.10617886 1.061789e-01           NA

## 92  ENSG00000167395    ZNF646   0.03097746 2.328356e-02 7.693900e-03

Visualizing cTWAS results

We could make locus plots for regions of interest. We could zoom in the region by specifying the locus_range.

make_locusplot(finemap_res,
               region_id = "16:71020125-72901251",
               weights = weights,
               ens_db = ens_db, 
               use_LD = TRUE,
               cor_dir = cor_dir,
               pip_thresh = 0.8,
               locus_range = c(71.6e6,72.4e6),
               gene_biotype="protein_coding",
               legend.position = "right")
## 2024-05-30 20:27:45 INFO::focus gene: HPR
## 2024-05-30 20:27:45 INFO::focus id: ENSG00000261701.6|expression_Liver
## 2024-05-30 20:27:45 INFO::locus_range: 71600000,72400000
## 2024-05-30 20:27:45 INFO::Load correlation matrices for region 16:71020125-72901251
## 2024-05-30 20:27:47 INFO::QTL positions: 72063820,72063928

 

If we do not have precomputed correlation matrices, we could compute those by specifying region_data, LD_info and snp_info. Or we could skip coloring correlations by setting use_LD = FALSE.
